ygData.subject: Quest Problems and More Quest Problems
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Christina! Hey, is EQ addictive or is it just me . . . Yeah, and that is not the last of my troubles/mishaps (apparently I m not very good at this
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Christina!

Hey, is EQ addictive or is it just me . . .

Yeah, and that is not the last of my troubles/mishaps
(apparently I'm not very good at this stuff) :o)

Last night I took the master key and two orc eyes
needed to get the sword. I read the text again, I even
asked someone who had just completed that quest and I
made sure I had what I needed. I went back to the guy
and give him the stuff and he took it once again and
happily said, thanks and I got nothing once again. I
was so mad. It didn't help when I realized the fault
was entirely mine in that I had given the guy the key,
one Orc eye, and one firebeetle eye; instead of two
orc eyes. They looked the same and I was tired when I
did it. (Should have been in bed) :o)

Finally, a 21st lvl Druid I talk to and have traveled
with a bit took pity on me, took me around, and sort
of "held my hand" and walked me through getting one of
the quest items step by step which was nice of him.
The point is, at least to me, the instructions were
not that clear unless you already had some kind of
knowledge of what was going on. At that point it seems
very obvious. But then perhaps I'm just a bit dense.
:o)

Ah well, live and learn.

:o)
Brangvyne
14th lvl Wood Elf Ranger


--- Christina Norman <tina@...>
wrote:
>
> Yikes it sucks to lose stuff to quests =(
>
> A good thing to do is before you hand in any quest
> items talk to the NPC
> again and listen very carefully to the exact
> instructions. I am ultra
> paranoid about this stuff, but I have never lost a
> quest item. The
> instructions are usually very precise.
>
> - Christina
>
> On Tue, 19 Nov 2002, Brangvyne Accampo wrote:
>
> > Salutations Sinrianna!
> >
> > You don't even want to know what I did last night
> with
> > that quest.
> > :o)
> >
> > But maybe someone will get a laugh out of my
> > stupidity.
> > :o)
> >
> > I finally got together all the things I needed for
> the
> > tunic. I never did find the forest drakling scale
> but
> > I found someone who had one and offered to sell it
> to
> > me and asked what I would give them. I told them
> that
> > I didn't have any idea what anything cost but
> would
> > pay them whatever the fair price was. They told me
> > that they used to get 50pp but that they would
> sell it
> > to me for 20pp and that to be nice they would let
> me
> > have it for 10pp if that was all I could afford.
> Well
> > I had the 20pp and I didn't want to take advantage
> of
> > anyone so I gave it to them. (Yes, I'm a sucker)
> > :o)
> >
> > Then I took all my stuff back to the Ranger guild
> > house and gave it to the Ranger who gave me the
> quest,
> > I forget the name. He took all the stuff, told me
> > thank you, and that was it. I didn't get anything,
> no
> > tunic, no exp., no nothing. I was so upset I
> didn't
> > know whether to laugh or cry . . .
> > :o)
> >
> > So, after standing there for a long time kicking
> > myself I asked them for the quest all over again.
> > Oddly, this time they gave me the box to put
> > everything in and they also gave me a pattern for
> an
> > "enchanted tunic"? Not sure what that is all about
> as
> > there are not enough slots in the box to fit the
> stuff
> > and the tunic.
> > :o)
> >
> > Anyway, I went back out and started gathering
> stuff
> > again. Still need to regain a couple items,
> including
> > that silly Forest Drakling Scale, but now I'm
> paranoid
> > about the exact approach to take to not lose
> > everything again. Apparently, I did or said
> something
> > wrong last time.
> > :o)
> >
> > Oh well, live and learn I guess, but it certainly
> > didn't make me feel any better when I was telling
> > someone about the whole thing later and they told
> me I
> > had been ripped off on the price of the Forest
> > Drakling Scale . . . ouch!
> >
> > Anyway, just thought I'd throw that out in case
> anyone
> > was interested at all.
> >
> > :o)
> > Brangvyne
> > 13th lvl Wood Elf Ranger
> >
> > PS - I came across a master key in CB last night
> and I
> > have the two Orc eyes for the sword. For any more
> > experienced rangers out there, is there anything
> > special I need to do to give this to the Ranger in
> the
> > guild and actually get the sword instead of losing
> > that too.
> >
> > --- Sinrianna Soulsteal <sinrianna@...>
> wrote:
> > >
> > > LOL ... someone in guild was just complaining
> about
> > > that earlier today :) ... they're a pain but,
> the
> > > newbie armor quests are worth it in the long run
> :)
> > > Have fun, and hunt safe ~
> > > Sinrianna Soulsteal
